comment: Dr Meeks is one of the best professors I have ever taken. He holds us to a very high standard but he does genuinely care. He has high ambitions for the band and wants to teach us all skills that we will use in our professional lives. 10/10 professor if you are considering taking him please do

Very unprofessional and I would even say disrespectful, not to any one person but in general with stereotypes of the millennial/ gen Z age groups. While I never had a personal confrontation with him I know many who did, many kids who were left in tears afterwards. Good students who did well in his class but felt all the worse for it. Not impressed.

It's weird to come and rate my band director on RMP lol...but I need y'all to know and understand that Dr. Meeks is going to be one of the most influential people you meet in your entire life. You will not understand it while you're sitting in that seat listening to him talk, but one day, you WILL understand. Give him a chance to change your life!

Dr. Meeks is one of the best directors out there. I do university band for fun outside of my major (biology), and Dr. Meeks makes it incredibly fun and entertaining while also challenging us with intricate music and holding us to the highest standard. He clearly is passionate and excited about what he does and is a breath of fresh air @KSU.
Absolutely a fabulous Professor, by far one of my favorites. He was very supportive in giving honest and open feedback while allowing for continuous growth within our ensemble and each section.

Doctor Brandon Meeks (Director of Athletic Bands) is perhaps the greatest band director in the history of band directors, maybe ever. He has taken a good startup marching band, and turned it into the greatest in the entire world. Phantom Regiment and UGA wish they could even hear a glimpse of the perfection that Dr. Meeks has created in us.

Best Band director I have yet to encounter, He takes the time to make sure that everyone succeeds and is moving at the same pace, He believes that we can all do bigger and better things and that we as a collective are very much on our way to making that dream happen.

To say that Dr. Meeks is a good band director is a major understatement. The things this guy does to expand and grow the Marching Owls is nothing short of incredible. I am so blessed to have him as my director. If anyone is reading this and thinking about taking one of his classes, please take it. He is one of, if not, the best professors at KSU.

Today's my last day of University Band, and I wanted to just take the time to appreciate Dr. Meeks. He makes every Monday class enjoyable, even if I've been having a rough day. He's serious when he needs to be but usually relaxed. On top of that, he really cares about every student, which I appreciate. I'm so glad I had him as my director.

One of the best directors and instructors I've known. Very knowledgeable about the things he teaches. Cares deeply for his student and is always willing to help. Any that have him for an ensemble WILL leave a better musician and any that have him for a music ed class WILL leave better prepared for directing their own ensemble someday. No doubt.

Dr. Meeks is without doubt the best band director I have had in my musical experience. I was considering quitting marching band after the last season I had wasn't so great. But I'm really glad I stuck around with it. Meeks knows when to be serious and when to joke around. Definitely a great director.
